hints.title: Exponential KL-Convergence for the Euclidean Gas
hints.content:
34: :label: thm-main-kl-convergence
35: 
36: Under Axiom {prf:ref}`ax-qsd-log-concave` (log-concavity of the quasi-stationary distribution), for the N-particle Euclidean Gas with parameters satisfying the Foster-Lyapunov conditions of Theorem 8.1 in [04_convergence.md](04_convergence.md), and with cloning noise variance $\delta^2$ satisfying:
37: 
38: $$
39: \delta > \delta_* = e^{-\alpha\tau/(2C_0)} \cdot C_{\text{HWI}} \sqrt{\frac{2(1 - \kappa_W)}{\kappa_{\text{conf}}}}
40: $$
41: 
42: the discrete-time Markov chain
43: 
44: $$
45: S_{t+1} = \Psi_{\text{total}}(S_t) := (\Psi_{\text{kin}}(\tau) \circ \Psi_{\text{clone}})(S_t)
46: $$
47: 
48: satisfies a discrete-time logarithmic Sobolev inequality with constant $C_{\text{LSI}} > 0$. Consequently, for any initial distribution $\mu_0$ with finite entropy:
49: 
50: $$
51: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \le e^{-t/C_{\text{LSI}}} \cdot D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_0 \| \pi_{\text{QSD}})
52: $$
53: 
54: where $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ is the unique quasi-stationary distribution.
55: 
56: **Explicit constant:** $C_{\text{LSI}} = O(1/(\gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}} \kappa_W \delta^2))$ where $\gamma$ is the friction coefficient, $\kappa_{\text{conf}}$ is the convexity constant of the confining potential, $\kappa_W$ is the Wasserstein contraction rate, and $\delta^2$ is the cloning noise variance.
